decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to generate a high storm count to cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. The deck uses a combination of tutors, rituals, and cantrips to quickly assemble the necessary resources to win the game in a single turn. Thoughtseize and Duress are included to disrupt opponent's strategies while Infernal Tutor and Past in Flames provide additional ways to find and cast key combo pieces. The deck features a streamlined mana base with efficient acceleration in the form of Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disruptive early plays to control the board and protect its threats. With a mix of efficient removal spells, countermagic, and hand disruption, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to close out the game quickly. By efficiently managing resources and applying pressure from multiple angles, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void. It combines aggressive early-game plays with disruptive elements to control the board and pressure opponents into making suboptimal plays. The deck also incorporates mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to help cast its high-cost Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. By overwhelming opponents with big threats and disrupting their plans, this deck aims to secure a fast victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It uses efficient mana acceleration and disruption spells to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main strategy is to search for the combo pieces using cards like Sylvan Scrying, Crop Rotation, and Expedition Map while using cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also includes protection for the combo with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Pithing Needle.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play by utilizing cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. The goal is to bypass traditional mana costs and overwhelm the opponent with huge threats early in the game. The deck also includes a number of counterspells and card draw spells to protect the combo and dig for key pieces. The strategy is to disrupt opponents and mana ramp into game-winning creatures for a decisive victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes cards like Sylvan Scrying, Crop Rotation, and Expedition Map to tutor for the necessary pieces. Duress, Thoughtseize, and Pithing Needle help to disrupt the opponent's strategy while cards like Vampire Hexmage and Abrupt Decay provide additional interaction. The deck also includes lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Karakas for utility and protection. The key strategy is to efficiently combo off and overwhelm the opponent with the powerful Marit Lage token.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, along with disruption in the form of counterspells and hand disruption. The deck aims to play efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler, while also keeping the opponent on their toes with cards like Wasteland and Daze. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and removal like Fatal Push, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through aggressive plays and timely disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Griselbrand or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn by using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. These big creatures can then overwhelm the opponent and secure a win. The deck also includes a variety of counterspells and card draw spells to protect the combo pieces and ensure consistency in drawing the necessary cards. The deck aims to win the game quickly and explosively through a strong combo strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive artifacts like Arcbound Ravager, Steel Overseer, and Vault Skirge to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also benefiting from cards like Wasteland and Karakas to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Walking Ballista provides additional disruption and removal options. Overall, the deck aims to establish board presence quickly and maintain pressure on the opponent through efficient artifact creatures.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Delver of Secrets, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Diabolic Edict. The deck also aims to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt. Additionally, the deck includes cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to ensure consistent card draw and selection.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan by utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker along with land destruction from cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland. It then leverages powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to tutor up key pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting opponents while applying quick and efficient threats to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through efficient removal spells and powerful card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck utilizes a versatile suite of removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Diabolic Edict, along with disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also incorporates powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Baleful Strix to pressure the opponent while controlling the game.

The deck focuses on generating a massive amount of mana through elves and Gaea's Cradle, then utilizing cards like Glimpse of Nature, Green Sun's Zenith, and Natural Order to chain together combos and quickly ramp into powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck relies on the synergy between elves, with cards like Quirion Ranger and Wirewood Symbiote providing the ability to untap creatures and generate even more mana. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive combo finish utilizing the strength of the elves in the deck.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays by utilizing cheap artifacts and efficient creatures. By combining the power of cards like Arcbound Ravager, Lodestone Golem, and Etched Champion with mana acceleration from City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early on. Chalice of the Void, Thorn of Amethyst, and Karakas are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect key pieces, while Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer provide additional ways to boost the deck's damage output.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro-Burn deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using a combination of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, along with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while efficiently burning them out with cards like Fireblast and Lava Spike. The inclusion of cards like Sulfuric Vortex and Eidolon of the Great Revel help to increase the damage output and prevent opponents from stabilizing.

The main focus of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to establish early board presence and apply consistent pressure on the opponent through cheap, efficient spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Delver of Secrets, and Chain Lightning, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of countermagic like Daze and Force of Will provides protection for key threats while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck can finish off opponents with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, ultimately aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.
